for_sales.sales_text:
‘Widget’ is a 16’ Haven 12½, Joel White’s centreboard version of Natt Herreshoffs’ original iconic Buzzards Bay 12½ and was described by White as ‘probably the best day sail boat ever designed’.

Built in 2014 using cedar strip construction with fibreglass / Sicomin epoxy sheathing inside and out and is therefore low maintenance. Keel logs are English oak with mahogany and teak decking and trim and a solid mahogany transom. The fore deck has a 12mm marine ply sub-deck with red teak straight laid boards which are sheathed in glass to show off the beautiful wood; the deck and spars have been re-varnished this year. All brightwork is finished with Tonkinois traditional varnish.

The mast and spars are solid Douglas fir and she has a 250kg lead keel with integral marine ply lifting centreplate which provides considerable stability. Standing rigging was supplied by Traditional Rigging of Bristol and the majority of fittings are bronze; the running rigging is ‘hemp’ lookalike cordage. The sails, made by Rowsell of Exmouth are in excellent condition.

Price includes a galvanised SBS braked, single axle trailer, new in 2014; a 4kg grapnel anchor, 5m chain and 30m warp. There is a ‘mast-down’ heavy duty tarpaulin for winter cover (new in 2019) and a ‘boom-up’ cockpit cover which can be used as a tent for camping.

The boat was completed in 2014 and has had limited use, all in fresh water.

This beautiful boat is a joy to sail, is simple to rig and is easily sailed single handed but can carry four adults comfortably.

Ashore near Bristol.

boat.full_description: Described as a keel / centreboard day sailer designed by Joel White, she is in fact a development of a design by Nat Herreshoff know as the Buzzards Bay 12.5 from 1914. The 12.5 relates to the waterline length, in feet. The White design reduced the overall draft and incorporated a centre plate which dropped through the 600lb lead keel. The original design was of carvel construction with 1/2 cedar planks screwed to steam bent oak ribs; the Widget design has been further modified to allow cedar strip and epoxy construction which has been glass sheathed.
